results.title: The World outdoors: flashing silver
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sinclair Productions and Douglas Sinclair
results.brief_description: Looks at sport fishing on Moresby Island - the southern island of the Queen Charlotte Islands off the northern coast of British Columbia. Shows in action Roderick Haig-Brown, author and prominent fly fisherman, who fishes only for sport and releases his catches unharmed.

group_works.title: TV news: behind the scenes
group_works.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John Barnes, Michael Livesey and Randolph Hobler

results.title: The World of Watteau
results.brief_description: Looks at the contemporary lifestyle of the French court at the beginning of the eighteenth century through the eyes of the painter Watteau. The refinement and grace of French court life at the beginning of the eighteenth century found its expression in the art of the French painter Antoine Watteau. He captures the rich satins and delicate laces of the courtly costumes, and the play of light, and shade is costumes, and the play of light and shade in the pleasure gardens with a lightness of touch and bold economy of line that foreshadows the Impressionists. But Watteau did more than reflect the surface charm of this world; he sensed the sadness and emptiness of lives spent in endless search of pleasure, a mood that underlines many of his greatest works.

results.title: The World of three
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: Home can be big and bewildering and the people in it can seem larger than life in the eyes of a three-year old boy. In this film such a little boy is observed in his response to his home environment, and what it means to be on the receiving end of what is called “child training” is reflected.

results.title: The World of the unborn. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the program explains what happens at the point of conception when the egg and sperm are formed and united. A discussion about DNA and chromosones is also included as well as an examination of the development and changes which occur during puberty. Part 2 examines the development of the fertilised egg as it implants itself in the wall of the uterus and the progression of the embryo to foetus until birth. Also featured are the physiological changes which occur during pregnancy. The photography and computer animation used in the program are outstanding.

results.title: The World of the molecule
results.brief_description: Nobel Prize winner Professor Hermann Staudinger speaks about macro molecules. In the age of mass consumption no branch of the chemical industry has experienced a boom such as that if the production of plastic.

results.title: The World of the Koala
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
Koalas manage to survive exclusively on a diet of eucalyptus leaves, and in this program we go twenty metres up into the trees to observe the endearing behaviour of mother koalas and their young. The program also observes the habitat and wildlife surrounding the koala, as well as threats to its survival such as bushfires and tree felling.

results.title: The World of the future

results.title: The World of the artist: three paintings by Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: Filmmakers, George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description: “The Adoration of the Kings”, “The Mocking of the Christ” and “Ecce Homo” are the three paintings of the Flemish artist Bosch simply and carefully analysed. Excellent color and absence of dramatisation distinguish this short art film. The three paintings are in the Johnson Collection in the Philadelphia Museum of Art.
